intro: Lepanthes brevipetala, commonly known as the short-petalled orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central America. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically feature bright colors such as yellow or orange. The plant grows in humid, shaded environments, often in the understory of tropical forests. Its leaves are usually oval and arranged in a rosette pattern, aiding in water retention. Lepanthes brevipetala is a member of the Orchidaceae family, known for its diverse and often striking floral structures.
